text:
AUSTRALIAN OPEN
		  
		  January 19, 2013
		  
		  Richard Gasquet
		  MELBOURNE, VICTORIA
		  R. GASQUET/I. Dodig
  4‑6, 6‑3, 7‑6, 6‑0

THE MODERATOR:  Questions, please. 

Q.  How did you find that match for yourself?
RICHARD GASQUET:  I think I start very bad.  I played not good at the start of the match.  He was starting good, the condition was fast, so it was a bit difficult for me, especially with the wind. 
I feel not good in my forehand, and same with my backhand.  A lot of tension.  I was losing 6‑3, 3‑1 with a break point, so it could be very difficult for me if he's winning two sets zero. 
Then I fight and I return better.  The third set was the key of the match, and I think in the fourth he was a little bit tired.  But I fight as much as I could, and played well.  At the end of the match I play better.

Q.  What can you say about your opponent?  Is he a player to watch in the future?
RICHARD GASQUET:  I think he's a good player, but he's a good player.  He's in the third round, so for sure he's tough to beat.

FastScripts Transcript by ASAP Sports

Then I fight and I return better. The third set was the key of the match, and I think in the fourth he was a little bit tired. But I fight as much as I could, and played well. At the end of the match I play better.
